Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on Blood Transfusion in Total Knee Replacement

Participants.evidence: Conducted at Hospital Melaka, this retrospective cross-sectional study included 296 adult patients who underwent elective primary unilateral TKR from January 2015 to December 2019. Participants were selected based on primary knee osteoarthritis and unilateral TKR, excluding those with haematological disorders or secondary osteoarthritis.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the prevalence of ABT and identify factors affecting transfusion and blood loss.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the prevalence of ABT, assessed postoperatively.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Conducted at Hospital Melaka, this retrospective cross-sectional study included 296 adult patients who underwent elective primary unilateral TKR from January 2015 to December 2019.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The prevalence of ABT was 4.39% (95% CI 2.04, 6.74). Pre-operative haemoglobin was the only significant factor associated with ABT (P<0.001; OR=0.35; 95% CI 0.22, 0.54). Prolonged tourniquet time (>120 minutes) significantly increased blood loss, with participants having 2.67 times the odds of >2 g/dL blood loss compared to those with ≤120 minutes (95% CI=1.54, 4.64).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was not registered as a trial
